user_query: over and set up his friend and got them killed are starting to get their comeuppance there's a lot of convenience in the third act there is a lot of convenience first of all just the way that he's able to escape with a number of people that are around there when he goes back in to save the girl and shoots the dude and walks out with her and drives off and then he got people chasing him and then the kids just happen to be there and then whenever the traffic goes away and he sees the two chicks that led him there that the ones that they were sleeping with he gets on a train it just happens to be the same train that the Dutch businessman is sitting on and again I like seeing all the Revenge that's the side of the gore and the killing that I actually get pumped up for I'm like yeah I'll fuck him up get back at him but I just wish they could have found a way to execute those last 10 to 15 minutes without feeling so contrived but all in all guys Hostel is a movie that is interesting because it's absolutely left an impact on me it's a movie I will never forget I will always tell that story and laugh with my dad about how fucked up we felt leaving that film but this is not a horror classic this is not anything that I would recommend to most people that I know and it's not a movie that I ever really care to re-watch very often if I wasn't revisiting it for 31 on 31 I don't know how many years would pass before I eventually Revisited it so it exists it's a movie that I think is done
